title: Aural - treble clef rhythm, compound meter

content.description: Identify the rhythm. You will have ten seconds to read the choices carefully before the example is played. You will hear the example played twice, with a brief pause between playings. Listen to the music and identify the rhythm that matches the example played.
content.question: Which of the following is played?

choices.label: Two measures of a melody in six-eight. The rhythms are dotted eighth, sixteenth, eighth, eighth, sixteenth, sixteenth, eighth, quarter, sixteenth, sixteenth, dotted quarter.
Two measures of a melody in six-eight. The rhythms are dotted eighth, sixteenth, eighth, dotted eighth, sixteenth, sixteenth, sixteenth, quarter, sixteenth, sixteenth, dotted quarter.
Two measures of a melody in six-eight. The rhythms are quarter, sixteenth, sixteenth, dotted eighth, sixteenth, sixteenth, sixteenth, dotted eighth, sixteenth, eighth, dotted quarter.
Two measures of a melody in six-eight. The rhythms are quarter, sixteenth, sixteenth, eighth, sixteenth, sixteenth, eighth, dotted eighth, sixteenth, eighth, dotted quarter.

content.answer: Two measures of a melody in six-eight. The rhythms are dotted eighth, sixteenth, eighth, dotted eighth, sixteenth, sixteenth, sixteenth, quarter, sixteenth, sixteenth, dotted quarter.

unit.text: 1: Music Fundamentals I - Pitch, Major Scales and Key Signatures, Rhythm, Meter, and Expressive Elements

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Use symbols and terms to describe features of rhythm in performed music, including meter, note values, and rhythmic patterns and devices.
